title: Trump, Denmark have 'fundamental disagreement' over Greenland but will keep talking, officials say
desc: Officials from Denmark and Greenland held a news conference after meeting with Trump administration officials.

title: Russia watches as ally Iran edges closer to collapse. Here's why it matters for Moscow
desc: The prospect of another ally falling in the Middle East will be a worrying one for Moscow, particularly after it has seen other alliances collapse recently.

title: Trump's war on the Fed threatens global financial stability, European central bankers warn
desc: European central bankers said an "obedient" Fed under White House control would be "extremely grave" for global financial stability.

title: Why the stock market keeps shrugging as Trump sows more political chaos
desc: The market rebounded back to all-time highs Monday despite the probe.

title: Senate expected to vote on Venezuela war powers resolution on Wednesday
desc: The Trump administration is lobbying senators to kill the measure.

title: Supreme Court tariff ruling: It's not just about refunds. Volume of U.S. freight trade could hinge on decision
desc: Logistics experts tell CNBC that freight shipping container trade could see a bump if the Supreme Court rules President Trump's IEEPA tariffs are illegal.

title: Big Tech is poaching energy talent to fuel its AI ambitions
desc: Hires of energy-related talent by Big Tech was 30% higher in 2025 than pre-AI levels.

title: Trump’s latest geopolitical gambits all lead back to China
desc: President Donald Trump's international interventions may all come down to one thing: China and its dominance of critical minerals.

title: Tariffs and AI's downside pose top global risks for business, World Economic Forum says
desc: The report captures a shifting landscape where geoeconomic confrontation leaps to the top spot on the list of business worries over the next two years

title: Bank of America tops estimates on better-than-expected net interest income, equities trading
desc: Bank of America, the second-largest U.S. bank by assets, has been a beneficiary of the industry's recent tail winds.

title: How activist investors plan to take on Big Oil at the 2026 AGM season
desc: In its newly revised strategy, Dutch group Follow This said it would will focus on the financial risks associated with declining oil and gas demand.

title: Citigroup tops estimates on stronger net interest income, smaller loan loss provision
desc: Under CEO Jane Fraser, Citigroup is in the midst of a restructuring, selling off parts of its overseas operations.

title: Greenland's PM has a blunt message for Trump: 'We choose Denmark' over the U.S.
desc: U.S., Danish and Greenlandic officials are set to hold crunch talks at the White House on Wednesday.

title: European stocks close higher as focus shifts to Greenland talks; BP warns of $5 billion impairment charge
desc: European stocks ended higher on Wednesday as investors in the region focused on a meeting between U.S. and Danish officials to discuss Greenland.

title: Saks Global, the longtime leader of luxury department stores, files for bankruptcy protection
desc: Saks Global, which also owns Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman, filed for bankruptcy protection after running out of cash.

title: CNBC's The China Connection newsletter: Battle for the recovering luxury market heats up
desc: Louis Vuitton’s newest Beijing store opened with celebrity buzz but little fanfare, underscoring how luxury brands are cautiously testing signs of a consumer recovery in China.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Worries over Iran and Fed independence weigh on markets
desc: U.S. President Donald Trump said Tuesday that he had "cancelled all meetings with Iranian Officials."

title: South Korea's special prosecutor seeks death penalty for ex-President Yoon over martial law bid
desc: If Yoon is sentenced to death, it will be the first execution South Korea has carried out in almost 30 years.

title: A major development in Trump's Fed feud is set to happen next week in the Supreme Court
desc: Supreme Court arguments on Jan. 21 will likely be the next big development for the central bank's quest to maintain independence.

title: CNBC's UK Exchange newsletter: The battle for Britain’s investment trusts
desc: The investment trust sector in the U.K. is being targeted by one of Wall Street’s most famous activist investors — putting some well-known names at risk.

title: China's annual trade surplus hits a record $1.2 trillion, even as exports to U.S. decline by 20%
desc: China's exports growth in December sharply beat expectations, catapulting the annual trade surplus to a record high.

title: Japanese stocks hit another record high as expectations of snap poll rise
desc: This comes as Japan's ruling LDP under Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is expected to call an election in February.

title: Trump’s tariff gambit over Iran risks derailing U.S.–China trade deal
desc: President Donald Trump's threat of 25% tariffs on countries doing business with Iran has raised the risk of derailing Washington's fragile trade deal with Beijing.

title: Trump attacks Powell again amid Fed independence fears: 'That jerk will be gone soon'
desc: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon defended the Fed's independence amid the probe of Powell by Trump's DOJ, echoing Republicans' criticisms.

title: Meta's VR layoffs, studio closures underscore Zuckerberg's massive pivot to AI
desc: Meta began laying off employees in its Reality Labs division focused on virtual reality and shut down several VR studios as it pushes resources towards AI.

title: Global central bankers unite in defense of Fed Chair Jerome Powell
desc: Global central bankers issued a statement Tuesday defending U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell following the launch of a criminal investigation into the central bank chief.

title: What Trump’s Venezuela intervention means for Guyana’s vast oil wealth
desc: Venezuela's Maduro had adopted an increasingly aggressive stance toward the disputed Essequibo region in recent years.

title: Alibaba-backed PixVerse launches real-time AI video tool, top executive tells CNBC
desc: Co-founder Jaden Xie told CNBC that the company is about to close another financing round, after raising $100 million in the last 6 months.

title: December core consumer prices rose at a 2.6% annual rate, less than expected
desc: Excluding volatile food and energy prices, the consumer price index showed a seasonally adjusted 0.2% gain on a monthly basis and 2.6% annually.

title: Boeing outsold Airbus last year for first time since 2018, deliveries rise to 600
desc: Boeing delivered 600 jetliners in 2025 with 63 in December alone, while net orders rose to 1,173 planes.
